headline.main: U.S. Panel Endorses Bypass Surgery for Obesity

byline.original: By WARREN E. LEARY, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Stomach bypass surgery is an effective option for severely obese people who have failed more moderate weight-reduction strategies, a Federal panel of experts concluded today. The panel of the National Institutes of Health met for three days to examine what is known about surgical treatments for those who are severely overweight. It concluded that surgical alterations of the digestive system appear to work for many people without severe side effects.
